P1.name: Tab Tornado
P1.description: 50+ tabs open, browser slowdown, memory hog
questions: How many browser tabs do you typically have open?
Which browser do you use?
Do you have multiple browser windows?
P1.calmResponse: Browsers can slow down with lots of open tabs. Let's get yours running smooth again.

P2.name: Storage Closet
P2.description: Disk full, hoarding files, never deletes anything
questions: When did you last see the storage warning?
Do you use cloud storage (iCloud/OneDrive/Google Drive)?
Is this your only storage device?
P2.calmResponse: Storage fills up over time. We'll find the space hogs and set up alerts so this doesn't surprise you again.

P3.name: Click-Yes Optimizer
P3.description: PUPs, toolbars, fake optimizers, clicks YES on everything
questions: Did you recently install any software or browser extension?
Are you seeing pop-ups or redirects?
Has your homepage or search engine changed?
P3.calmResponse: Unwanted software sneaks in easily. We'll clean it out and set up protection to block it in the future.

P4.name: Update Avoider
P4.description: Months behind on updates, 'don't fix what works' mentality
questions: When did you last update your operating system?
Have updates caused problems for you before?
Are there specific apps you're worried about updating?
P4.calmResponse: Updates can feel risky, but they fix security holes. We'll find a safe time and make a backup first.

P5.name: Password Spiral
P5.description: Locked out, no recovery options, password chaos
questions: Which account are you locked out of?
Do you have access to your recovery email or phone?
Do you use a password manager?
P5.calmResponse: Getting locked out is stressful. We'll map out your accounts and set up proper recovery options.

P6.name: Wi-Fi Whiplash
P6.description: Connection drops constantly, blames router, never checks device
questions: Does this happen on other devices too?
How far are you from the router?
Did this start after any changes (new router, moved desk)?
P6.calmResponse: Wi-Fi issues are frustrating. We'll figure out if it's the router, your device, or something in between.

P7.name: Peripheral Collector
P7.description: 5 printers, 3 mice, driver chaos, USB hub madness
questions: What device is having trouble?
Have you tried it on a different USB port or computer?
Did you recently add any new devices?
P7.calmResponse: External devices can get finicky. We'll clean out old drivers and get your setup working reliably.

P8.name: Cloud Sync Tangle
P8.description: iCloud + OneDrive + Google Drive = duplicates everywhere
questions: Which cloud services do you use?
Are files missing or duplicated?
Do you see any sync error messages?
P8.calmResponse: Multiple cloud services can fight over your files. We'll pick a winner and untangle the rest.

P9.name: Thermal Throttler
questions: Does it get hot during specific tasks?
When was the computer last cleaned inside?
How old is the device?
P9.calmResponse: Heat causes slowdowns and can damage components. We'll cool things down and set up a maintenance schedule.

P10.name: Creative Chaos
P10.description: Premiere + Photoshop, scratch disk full, external drives everywhere
questions: Which creative apps are you using?
Where are your project files stored?
Do you have a dedicated drive for scratch/cache?
P10.calmResponse: Creative apps need proper setup to run smoothly. We'll optimize your workflow and protect your work.

P11.name: Fine Yesterday
P11.description: 'It just stopped working', no idea what changed
questions: When exactly did it stop working?
Did anything update automatically (you might not have noticed)?
Did you see any error messages?
P11.calmResponse: Sometimes changes happen in the background. We'll find what changed and get you back to working.

P12.name: Hardware Failing Quietly
P12.description: Clicks, beeps, weird smells, SSD dying slowly
questions: Do you hear any unusual sounds?
How old is this device?
Have there been any physical impacts or liquid exposure?
P12.calmResponse: Hardware issues need quick attention. Let's run diagnostics and make sure your data is safe first.
